portfolio.settings.emission.national-fac: Yearly Australian national emission factors are published every 1st day of July.
portfolio.settings.emission.market-based: Market-based emission factors are specific to energy suppliers and linked to a type of energy and its production source.  The values entered should be based on contractual instruments with the energy supplier (e.g. energy attribute certificates, direct contracts or supplier-specific emissions rates). Note the instrument in the reference column below and attach documentation at the specific meter. In compliance with the GHG Protocol, where such market-based factors are not provided/available, Scaler will use the relevant location-based factors for market-based emissions accounting.

Create arbitrary regions (continents, countries, cities) where energy suppliers can have different emission factors for the same energy type. You will be able to select one of these energy supplier regions on an asset level to calculate the asset's emissions accordingly.

general.input-form.description.active: Turn this toggle on to enable the collection of current consumption data. Only when an asset is active can it be included in reporting outputs, in conjunction with the the toggle above. Only active assets are counted toward your invoice.
general.input-form.description.group_nam: Name of a (custom) group to which the asset belongs, e.g. G4 cities in the Netherlands. This field is a custom filter in the Analytics portal, so please ensure that spelling is correct.
general.input-form.description.entity_na: The legal entity to which this asset belongs.
general.input-form.description.number_of: The number of floors expressed according to the American English methodology, whereby the ground floor is counted as 1. A building which only has 1 storey, should be counted as 1. This field is used as input for determining the property sub type (low-, mid-, or high-rise).
general.input-form.description.gross_flo: The total floor area of the building including exterior walls, but excluding outdoor/exterior areas. This value must be larger than 0.
general.input-form.description.gross_int: The total gross internal area of the building, according to the definition used by CRREM: the enclosed area of a building within the external walls taking each floor into account but excluding the thickness of the external walls.
general.input-form.description.status: The 'Project started' date reflects the moment when the 'Status' of the asset was altered. When inputting a new value in the 'Status' field, Scaler will automatically designate the day before the 'Project started' date as the 'Project completed' date for the prior status.
general.input-page.embodied_carbon_end_o: Embodied Carbon - End Of Life Stage
general.input-form.description.window_gl: This field is used to differentiate between assets as double glazing is more efficient in terms of energy loss and storage than single glazing. If an asset has both single and double-paned windows, you may choose “combination”.
general.input-form.description.monumenta: Turn this toggle on to indicate that the asset has monumental status. This field is used to validate other data points as monuments may have different requirements to non monuments. This field is particularly relevant for reporting purposed, like SFDR and EU Taxonomy, as e.g. an EPC is not required for Dutch Monumental buildings.

general.input-form.description.covered_a:
The floor area that corresponds to this meter.
Please note:
a) The floor area entered cannot exceed the corresponding area entered under Reporting data for that reporting year;
b) If you do not enter a value manually for the covered area, the platform will use the corresponding area entered under Reporting data to populate this field;
c) If multiple meters are added covering the same 'Area type' and their total 'Covered area' exceeds the corresponding floor area entered in Reporting data, the consumption values will be added for all meters, but the maximum floor area used will be the floor are entered in 'Reporting data'.
d) Between Reporting data and 'Meter details', the area types map as follows:
- Gross floor area = Whole building
- Gross floor area = Shared services
- Common areas = Common area
- Tenant areas = Tenant space

i_portal.both_tenant_and_landlord_contro: Across and/or within Resources (energy, water, waste), there is misalignment in operational control (landlord vs. tenant) for 'Whole-building' meters. Please check that this is accurate and update the "Area type" variable where necessary. Please note: Where there are any 'Whole building - Landlord controlled' energy meters, GRESB requires that the entire asset be reported as 'Whole building - Tenant controlled'= FALSE. This impacts how energy consumption and GHG emissions can be reported and the interpretation of the landlord's ability to introduce and implement operating policies, which may impact scoring.

GRESB requires that Whole Building meters across and within Resources (energy, water, waste) all have the same operational control (landlord vs. tenant). Please align  the operational control across meters in the "Area type" variable.

portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-desc: Derived from performance across 7 ESG aspects and weighted based on industry standards, the score includes data coverage, like-for-like change and risk, but also considers the impact of performance intensities.
general.filters.owned-for-entire-period: Owned for 12 months during reporting year
general.surveys.review-survey-info:
New data collected via this survey is black. Existing data currently in Scaler is gray.

        Review the below survey for correctness. If you are satisfied, approve the survey by clicking the ‘Approve’ button in the top right corner. 'Approved' surveys auto-populate data in the Scaler Platform.

        To request changes to the newly collected data, click ‘Request changes’ in the top right corner. Select the relevant fields and add comments to explain the request.

        You can edit existing data for this asset in the Scaler Platform by clicking ‘Edit existing data’.
portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-desc: Out of a total 100 points, it provides you with a useful indication of average overall risk at the portfolio level and an acute reflection of actual building performance, risks, and opportunities at the asset level.
portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-info: How do we calculate the score?
portfolio.roadmap.net-zero-carbon-score-: Based on the CRREM Methodology, a score of 0 means that an asset or portfolio is already stranded in the current reporting year. A score of 100 means that an asset or portfolio is completely NZC according to the CRREM pathways.

portfolio.esg-data.emissions.default-fac: These metrics were calculated using our default location-based emissions factors. Toggle to the Data Collection Portal and navigate to Portfolio > Settings > Emission Factors to overwrite the default factors, or input your own market-based emission factors.
portfolio.esg-data.emissions.custom-fact: Toggle to the Data Collection Portal and navigate to Portfolio > Settings to verify you are satisfied with the emissions factors used. If desired, you can overwrite these default factors or edit market-based emission factors.

portfolio.roadmap.assets.stranded-carbon: Year the asset becomes stranded based on GHG emissions intensity and CRREM v2 1.5 degree pathway

The Measure group field is required.
Status is not allowed for this measure
portfolio.roadmap.assets.eui-red.desc: The estimated reduction in energy use intensity. This value will be used in EUI projection calculations for this asset and will impact its energy pathway and GHG/CO2 pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
portfolio.roadmap.assets.eui-red-on-site: The estimated reduction in off-site energy use intensity due to on-site renewable electricity. This value will be used only in CUI projection calculations for this asset and will therefore only impact the GHG pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
The energy source that will be reduced as a result of implementing this measure.
portfolio.roadmap.assets.asset-measure-t: The estimated reduction in energy use intensity. This value will not be used in EUI projection calculations for this asset, and will impact only GHG/CO2 pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
portfolio.gresb-data.modelere.warning: The GRESB Modeler is meant to be indicative, not predict your GRESB Score. It is limited where not all data points have been inputted and does not take benchmarking into consideration. The modeler is being updated to include 2024 scoring changes.
portfolio.gresb-data.gresb-asset-score.d: Provides a prediction of the points you can achieve for performance indicators directed at asset-level data (56.5/100 points in the real estate benchmark). The 56.5 points are normalized into a score out of 100.
The score is based on the current GRESB Real Estate Scoring Document. It does not account for the impact of annual benchmarking on scores.
portfolio.gresb-data.engagement.satisfac: Tenant Satisfaction Survey conducted in the last three years
asset.gresb-data.gresb-asset-score.desc-: The GRESB Asset Score applies the GRESB Scoring Methodology at the asset level, for asset-level indicators in the Performance Component.
It indicates what percentage of the total points available for asset-level indicators this asset can achieve.
asset.gresb-data.asset-score.desc-1: The Asset Score applies the Scoring Methodology at the asset level, for asset-level indicators in the Performance Component.
asset.gresb-data.asset-score.desc-2: It indicates what percentage of the total points available for asset-level indicators this asset can achieve.

portfolio.settings.emission.location-bas: Scaler uses the most recent CRREM location-based emissions factors as the default input for location-based emissions accounting. You can override these emissions factors by selecting an option from the dropdown box.
All required fields must be filled in and validated

Note that all required fields must be completed before inputted location-based emissions factors are in use. If you do not see a green 'validation checkmark' next to each country name, default location-based emissions factors are used in calculations.
Custom location-based factors have been enabled and will be used in calculations
The percentage by which the emissions factor decreases year-over-over from the baseline value through 2050. Scaler automatically calculates each yearly emissions factor value based on this rate.
portfolio.settings.emission.market-based: To implement the market-based method, enter emissions factors for portfolio regions and years

In Analytics -> ESG Data -> GHG emissions, a dropdown allows you switch between the location-based and market-based methods. Calculations are available for assets which are assigned an "Energy supplier region".
Review detected energy supplier regions below and click on the plus symbol to add new regions.
Market-based emissions factors vary according to energy supplier/retailer.
You must enter emissions factors for all years where there is consumption data for your portfolio.
Emissions factors for every region and year are required to implement the market-based method
All progress is auto-saved. Once complete, a toggle will appear under Analytics -> ESG Data -> GHG Emissions to switch between location-based and market-based.
Regions must be validated to implement the market-based method

A green validation check mark will appear when all emissions factors are filled in for a region and each region must be validated to implement the market-based method. All progress is auto-saved. Under Asset details, assign the relevant "Energy supplier region" to each asset. In Analytics -> ESG Data -> GHG emissions, a dropdown will appear to switch between the location-based and market-based methods.

general.estimations-in-beta-tooltip:
Please be aware:
        Our estimation model is in beta testing while we continue to train the algorithms with real data, collect client feedback, resolve outstanding bugs, and build additional models to address discrepancies with granularity limitations from reporting frameworks.

        Estimated data is not used in reporting outputs. Estimated data will not be available for all assets due to insufficient actual data. Estimated values of some assets exceed our validation thresholds and are therefore excluded.

        For more information on Scaler’s approach to estimated data, please visit the Scaler Knowledge Base: https://scaler-tech.notion.site/Estimation-Model-for-energy-26afc18012a740f2a89d82ca07e5a8f2
general.estimations-in-beta-tooltip-2: Our estimation model is in beta testing while we continue to train the algorithms with real data, collect client feedback, resolve outstanding bugs, and build additional models to address discrepancies with granularity limitations from reporting frameworks. Estimated data is not used in reporting outputs. Estimated data will not be available for all assets due to insufficient actual data. Estimated values of some assets exceed our validation thresholds and are therefore excluded.

Once a survey has been sent it can not be edited, deleted or re-sent.

        If you would like to re-use this survey, please go back to the Surveys homepage and duplicate the survey.
general.surveys.edit-create-info:
A single survey can request data across one or multiple data sections and is sent per asset to an individual. Assets can be assigned individually or in bulk.

        If multiple individuals need to fill in information for a single asset, please split the data sections across multiple surveys. Survey parameters can be duplicated.

        If you need assistance in determining how to split your surveys, please contact the Scaler team at client-services@scalerglobal.com.

surveys.meters.consumption.explanation-3: Additionally, waste consumptions include the option to add the number of waste bins, volume of waste bins, filling level of waste bins and cost.

i_portal.procurement_types_PPT_tooltip: Default delivered renewable electricity from the grid in a market with at least a 95% renewable generation mix and where there is no mechanism for specifically allocating renewable electricity
i_portal.procurement_types_MIX_tooltip: Refers to having a mix of the stated procurement mechanisms for the individual asset
i_portal.market_base_claims_BUN_tooltip: Reflects the situation in which the purchase of physical electricity and the associated environmental attributes (EACs) are sold together as part of the same transaction or contract. This creates a clear link between the Renewable Energy being consumed and its environmental benefits.
i_portal.market_base_claims_UNB_tooltip: Refers to a situation where Energy Attribute Certificates (EACs) are separated from the physical electricity they represent and sold or traded independently of the actual energy. The “Unbundled” option should be selected if EACs are acquired via virtual power purchase agreements (VPPAs) or to reflect the use of “replacement Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs)” or “REC arbitrage” in which the original EACs of a particular energy procurement contract are substituted for others on an EAC market.
i_portal.market_base_claims_NMC_tooltip: Reflects when no EACs are retired in correspondence with the energy consumption. Importantly, this option must be selected if the EACs corresponding with the energy consumption are sold as opposed to being retired.
i_portal.market_base_claims_MIX_tooltip: Reflects that status that there is a known combination of “bundled” and “unbundled”. This does not include situations for which a portion of the reported Renewable Energy exhibits no market-based claim – i.e. did not retire the associated EACs
i_portal.market_base_claims_UNK_tooltip: Reflects the situation in which it is unknown if EACs were retired for any portion of the reported Renewable Energy.
i_portal.proximities_SAM_tooltip: GRESB will align to the RE100 Technical Criteria (2022), Appendix B: Market Boundaries, regarding what constitutes a “market”.
i_portal.proximities_DIM_tooltip: GRESB will align to the RE100 Technical Criteria (2022), Appendix B: Market Boundaries, regarding what constitutes a “market”.
i_portal.proximities_MIX_tooltip: Reflects if there is a known proportion between EACs from the “same market” as the reported consumption and EACs from a “different market” as the reported consumption. GRESB will align to the RE100’s Technical Criteria regarding what constitutes a “market”.
i_portal.proximities_UNK_tooltip: Reflects uncertainty, for any portion of the market-based Renewable Energy claim, if the EACs retired pertain to the “same” or a “different” market as the market in which the energy was consumed.
i_portal.vintages_of_generation_PEY_tool: The vintage of the retired EAC falls within either the "performance year" (i.e., the year in which the energy consumption occurred) or within a relevant certification/regulation-backed eligibility window (e.g., Green-e's 21-month eligibility window, or the European Energy Certificate System’s countryspecific Domain Protocols). Such windows must be designed for EACs of voluntary retail markets and not for the compliance of national or regional government commitments (e.g., renewable portfolio standards, or the Australian Government Clean Energy Regulator’s ’Renewable Energy Target’, which sometimes have larger eligibility windows.
i_portal.vintages_of_generation_MIX_tool: Reflects if there is a known proportion between EACs from the “performance year/period” as the reported consumption and EACs not from the performance year/period as the reported consumption.
i_portal.vintages_of_generation_UNK_tool: Reflects uncertainty, for any portion of the market-based Renewable Energy claim, as to whether the EACs retired correspond or not to the performance year/period in which the energy was consumed.

portfolio.settings.emission.national-fac: Scaler emission factors: CRREMv2.03 + EPA + NGA + ESPM: This set of emission factors is comprised of factors from CRREM's Risk Assessment Tool v2.03, CRREM Pathways V2.3, EPA factors from eGRID 2022, and NGA 2024 factors. Select a country to view its source set of factors and customize where available.
Manual: This set of emission factors is an editable copy of the default set. You can override any cell to use value to use a custom emission factor for the respective country, source, and year.

Baseline factor and annual rate of change: This set of emission factors lets you manually configure the factors of the baseline year, and the rate of change year-over-year. The values of the following periods will be automatically extrapolated based on these two.

Baseline factor and development of grid of CRREM: This set of emission factors lets you manually configure the factors of the baseline year, and uses the rate of grid development based on the CRREM version in the default set to automatically extrapolate values for the coming years.
CRREM 2.02: This set of emission factors is comprised of factors from CRREM's Risk Assessment Tool v2.02.

CRREM 2.03: This set of emission factors is comprised of factors from CRREM's Risk Assessment Tool v2.03, CRREM Pathways V2.3, EPA factors from eGRID 2022, and NGA 2024 factors. Select a country to view the source of its set of factors, and change it where available

CRREM 2.05: This set of emission factors is comprised of factors from CRREM's Risk Assessment Tool v2.05, CRREM Pathways V2.3, EPA factors from eGRID 2022, and NGA 2024 factors. Select a country to view the source of its set of factors, and change it where available

asset.input-portal.what-is-a-meter-toolt: A meter represents any point of resource consumption as defined by your organization, both where you are and are not able to collect consumption data.  Examples: 1) A whole-building, off-site electricity meter and a DHC meter, each covering total GFA, plus a natural gas meter covering 50% GFA. 2) An on-site electricity meter for the landlord-controlled, common area where you have access to data, plus tenant meter(s) covering all tenant floor area, even where you can't collect consumption data.
general.assets.note-for-running-scaler-c: Please note that to run calculations in Scaler, all "Errors" and "Missing Data" alerts for the Scaler report must first be resolved. Once these issues are addressed, Scaler will automatically process the calculations and update the Data Completion percentage. Until then, Data Completion will not be displayed and will remain at (-).
general.input-page.energy_rating_operati: Energy Rating, Operational, Design and/or Construction
general.input-form.add_consumption_corre: A correction/adjustment to original consumption data.
general.input-form.consumption_correctio: Where there has been a correction to a consumption amount (e.g. invoice adjustment), add the correction value in the ‘Consumption’ column along with the associated time period. Additional consumption should be entered as a positive value; less consumption should be entered as a negative value.
general.input-form.description.comment: Optional field to provide comments in a given tab, section or for a specific variable.
general.input-form.description.relevant_: The earliest date from which the value of the corresponding field took effect. In many cases, this date is used to associate the corresponding field to a reporting period, especially in the case of fiscal year reporting. As such, the month and year are more significant than a specific day.
general.input-form.description.unit: The unit in metric or imperial corresponding to the value entered for the field.
general.input-form.description.postal_co: A series of letters, integers or both, sometimes including spaces or punctuation, used in a postal address for the purpose of sorting mail. This is also referred to as the postcode, post code, PIN or ZIP Code.
general.input-form.description.currency: The currency related to the corresponding monetary field. For some variables, where indicated, this is tied to the currency defined in Portfolio Settings. For other variables, like those under Roadmap Measures, this may be defined per measure.
general.input-form.description.start_dat: The start of the period to which the reported data relates. This is either 1 January for calendar year reporting or the start of your organization's fiscal year.
general.input-form.description.end_date_: The end of the period to which the reported data relates. This is either 31 December for calendar year reporting or the end of your organization's fiscal year.
general.input-form.description.street_ad: The physical street or postal address of the asset.
general.input-form.description.house_num: The street number of the asset.
general.input-form.description.city: The city, town or village where the asset is located.
general.input-form.description.latitude: The geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of the asset on the surface of the Earth.
general.input-form.description.longitude: The geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of the asset on the surface of the Earth.
general.input-form.description.weather_s: Asset-specific, manually added weather station for the purpose of inputting and using normalized heating/cooling degree days intensities.
general.input-form.description.property_: Property type classification of the asset, aligned with CRREM/GRESB. If you have a different categorization, please align this with CRREM/GRESB.
Property sub-type classification of the asset, aligned with CRREM/GRESB. If you have a different categorization, please align this with CRREM/GRESB.
general.input-form.description.construct: The year in which the building was completed and ready for use, regardless of whether the asset has been under major renovation since then.
general.input-form.description.compliant: Whether this specific economic activity (the asset) complies with the OECD Guidelines on Multinational Enterprises on Responsible Business Conduct. The OECD MNE Guidelines include non-binding principles and standards for business with a responsible conduct, considering a global context consistent with applicable laws and internationally recognised standards.

Whether your company and this specific economic activity (the asset) comply with the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGPs), a framework for companies to report on with respect to human rights.
general.input-form.description.weight_of: The weight of the raw building materials in kg, i.e. the total weight of building materials less what is recovered, recycled, or biosourced.
general.input-form.description.total_wei: The total weight of all building materials in kg, i.e. the weight including both what is raw and what is recovered/recycled/biosourced.
general.input-form.description.building_:
EU Taxonomy technical screening criteria for ‘substantial contribution’ for:
- Activity 7.2. Renovation of existing buildings
- environmental objective: Climate Change Mitigation.
(Compliance may be met through alternative criteria, a reduction of primary energy demand (PED) of at least 30 %, recorded via another variable.)

EU Taxonomy (alternative) technical screening criteria for ‘substantial contribution’ for:

- Activity 7.2. Renovation of existing buildings;
- environmental objective: Climate Change Mitigation.
(Compliance may be met through other, primary criteria, recorded via another variable.)
general.input-form.description.involved_: Whether the asset is considered to be active in the fossil fuel sector.
general.input-form.description.equipped_: Whether the asset is equipped with facilities for waste sorting and if it is covered by a waste recovery or recycling contract. It is mandatory for companies to report in their SFDR PAI statement their share of investments in assets that do not meet this criteria.
general.input-form.description.effective: For heating and air-conditioning, the effective rated output means the maximum output (in kW) during operation, as specified by the system manufacturer. More information can be found in Articles 2(17) 14 and 15, of EU Directive 2010/31/EU (the Energy Performance Building Directive). Where the building is a large non-residential building with an effective rated output of over 290 kW, it must be efficiently operated through energy performance monitoring and assessment in order to comply with the 'substantial contribution criteria' for 'climate change mitigation'.
general.input-form.description.building_: Energy performance contracts (EPCs) are agreements between a building owner and an EPC service provider to improve the energy efficiency of a building. The EPC service provider typically identifies and implements energy-saving measures, and the building owner agrees to pay for the measures over a period of time. If the effective rated output of a non-residential building is over 290 kW, it must be efficiently operated through an EPC in order to comply with the 'substantial contribution criteria' for 'climate change mitigation'.
general.input-form.description.embodied_: The total greenhouse gas emissions (in kgCO2) associated with the materials and processes used in the construction of the asset.
general.input-form.description.vol_of_bi: Volume (in liters) of bio-based or reused / recycled materials (UNEP FI-Positive Impact Real Estate Investment Framework)
general.input-form.description.vol_of_ma: Volume of materials (in liters) sourced matching with EU Taxonomy thresholds
general.input-form.description.full_flus: Recorded in (liters), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 6 liters.
general.input-form.description.waste_gen: Waste generation (in kg) (by way of handling) during construction phase (construction companies should report significant waste types (hazardous and nonhazardous) from construction, demolition and excavation (CD&E) activities) (G4 Sector Disclosures-EN23)
general.input-form.description.testing_p: EU Taxonomy technical screening criteria for ‘substantial contribution’ for: Activity 7.1. Construction of new buildings; upon completion, buildings larger than 5000 m2; environmental objective: Climate Change Mitigation. (Compliance may be met through alternative criteria, recorded via another variable.)
general.input-form.description.robust_an: EU Taxonomy (alternative) technical screening criteria for ‘substantial contribution’ for: Activity 7.1. Construction of new buildings; buildings larger than 5000 m2; environmental objective: Climate Change Mitigation. (Compliance may be met through other, primary criteria, recorded via another variable.)
general.input-form.description.life_cycl: EU Taxonomy technical screening criteria for ‘substantial contribution’ for: Activity 7.1. Construction of new buildings; buildings larger than 5000 m2; environmental objective: Climate Change Mitigation.
general.input-form.description.maximum_f: Recorded in (liters/min), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 6 liters/min.

Recorded in (liters/min), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 8 liters/min.
general.input-form.description.gross_ass: The gross asset value of the asset at the end of the reporting period, entered in millions.
general.input-form.description.maximum_a: Recorded in (liters), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 3.5 liters.
general.input-form.description.maximum_u: Recorded in (liters/bowl/hour), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 2 liters.
general.input-form.description.maximum_f: Recorded in (liters), relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 1 liter.
general.input-form.description.environme: Relevant to EU Taxonomy; generic criteria for 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 1 liter.
general.input-form.description.average_v: The average vacancy rate is a measure of the level of vacant space in a given year. It is calculated based on the asset’s total net leasable area, NOT the rental value of the asset. Enter the percentage as a number, e.g. 3% should be entered as 3.
general.input-form.description.gross_ren: The annual gross rental income of the asset at the end of the reporting period, entered in millions.
general.input-form.description.operators: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Transition to a circular economy.
general.input-form.description.building_: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Transition to a circular economy.
Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control.
general.input-form.description.mg_of_for: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control.
general.input-form.description.mg_of_oth: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control. EU Taxonomy alignment threshold is 0.001 mg/m3.
general.input-form.description.number_of: The number of rental units in the asset.
general.input-form.description.located_o: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control.
general.input-form.description.subject_t: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control.
general.input-form.description.measures_: Relevant to EU Taxonomy 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Pollution prevention and control.
general.input-form.description.eia_compl: Relevant to EU Taxonomy; generic criteria for 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Protection and restoration of biodiversity and ecosystems.
general.input-form.description.not_built: Relevant to EU Taxonomy; generic criteria for 'Do no significant harm' principle for objective: Protection and restoration of biodiversity and ecosystems.
general.input-form.description.raw_mater: Emissions from the extraction and initial processing of raw materials, such as mining or harvesting. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.transport: Emissions from transporting raw materials to manufacturing facilities. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.manufactu: Emissions from manufacturing processes that convert raw materials into finished products. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.transport: Emissions from transporting finished products to the construction site. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.carbon_of: Whether the off-site electricity consumption purchased by the tenant for the asset has been offset.
general.input-form.description.construct: Emissions arising from on-site construction and installation activities, including energy use and waste generation. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.use_b1: Emissions occurring during the building's use phase that are not related to energy consumption, such as material emissions or chemical reactions. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.maintenan: Emissions associated with the maintenance of building components to ensure their intended performance. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.repair_b3: Emissions resulting from repairing building components that have failed or deteriorated. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.replaceme: Emissions from replacing building components or materials during the building's lifecycle. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.refurbish: Emissions associated with major renovations or upgrades to the building. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.deconstru: Emissions from the processes involved in dismantling or demolishing the building at the end of its life. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.transport: Emissions resulting from transporting demolition waste to disposal or recycling facilities. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.waste_pro: Emissions from processing waste materials for recycling, reuse, or disposal. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.disposal_: Emissions from processing waste materials for recycling, reuse, or disposal. Measured in kgCO₂/m² as per LETI's whole life carbon methodology.
general.input-form.description.gross_flo: Typically defined as the total floor area of spaces shared across building occupants, including entrance areas, corridors, lifts, staircases, waste storage stores, communal kitchens, breakout facilities, shared restroom facilities, etc. COMMON AREA plus TENANT AREA must equal GFA.
Typically defined as the total floor area that is lettable to tenants, both vacant and let/leased areas. TENANT AREA plus COMMON AREA must equal GFA.
general.input-form.description.gross_int: Can be defined as the total area of the spaces shared across building occupants, measured to the internal face of the perimeter walls. Or in other words, the common areas excluding the external/perimeter walls.
Can be defined as the total floor area that is lettable to tenants, measured to the internal face of the perimeter walls. Or in other words, the tenant areas excluding the external/perimeter walls.
general.input-form.description.gross_usa: Can be defined as the total usable area of the spaces shared across building occupants, measured to the internal face of the perimeter walls. This may exclude, for example, shared restroom facilities.
general.input-form.description.technical: This field can refer to the individual or company that is hired to oversee the technical operations of the asset.
general.input-form.description.property_: This field is used as a filter in Scaler and can refer to the individual or company that is hired to oversee the day-to-day operations of the asset. Real estate investment managers typically hire property managers when they are unwilling or unable to manage the day-to-day operations of an asset themselves.
general.input-form.description.gross_usa: Can be defined as the total usable area that is lettable to individual tenants, measured to the internal face of the perimeter walls. This may include, for example, corridors and kitchens in a single-tenant floor.
general.input-form.description.gross_flo: The total floor area of outdoor/exterior areas.
general.input-form.description.vegetated: The total area of vegetation on a site, including vegetated roofs, terraces and walls.
general.input-form.description.total_sur: The total surface area of the plot, including walls/facades and roofs.
general.input-form.description.number_of: Total number of employees related to this asset, for your own record keeping.
general.input-form.description.asset_man: This field can refer to either an individual in your own organization who is responsible for the asset management of this asset, i.e. someone making investment decisions to help grow the portfolio, or another organization contracted to do the same.
general.input-form.description.percent_o: Percentage of the asset owned by the reporting entity. Enter the percentage as a whole number, e.g. 100% should be entered as 100.
general.input-form.description.number_of: The total number of on-site solar panels that deliver renewable energy to the asset and/or generate renewable energy that is redirected to the grid.
general.input-form.description.installed: The total power-generating capability of all the solar panels installed on the asset in kW, representing the maximum amount of electricity that the solar panels can generate under optimal conditions. You may know this value rather than knowing the number of panels + average watt-peak.
general.input-form.description.orientati: The cardinal direction the solar panels are facing, for your own internal use.
general.input-form.description.solar_pan: Descriptive text regarding the solar panel, such as the brand, type of panel or other description.
Description of the method used to calculate the installed capacity. You may know the average installed capacity instead of relying on the total number of panels * average of the watt-peaks.
general.input-form.description.vintage_o: The year or time period when the renewable energy was generated.
general.input-form.description.solar_pan: The systems or areas within the asset that are powered by solar panels, such as thermal energy storage systems (e.g., heat and cold storage) or specific building areas like common spaces.
general.input-form.description.solar_rea: Whether the roof of the asset is suitable for solar panel installation, considering structural integrity and orientation.
general.input-form.description.solar_pan: Any additional comments regarding solar panels.
general.input-form.description.amount_of: The total number of parking spots on the premises of the asset, both with and without electric charging facilities.
Number of parking spaces equipped with charging stations for electric vehicles on the premises of the asset.
general.input-form.description.carbon_of: Whether the off-site electricity consumption purchased by the landlord for the asset has been offset.
Whether the fuel consumption purchased by the landlord for the asset has been offset.
Whether the fuel consumption purchased by the tenant for the asset has been offset.
Whether the district heating and cooling consumption purchased by the landlord for the asset has been offset.
Whether the district heating and cooling consumption purchased by the tenant for the asset has been offset.
general.input-form.description.certifica: The certification/rating/label group under which the following details fall.
The specific certification/rating/label scheme name and/or sub-scheme name.
general.input-form.description.rec_start: The beginning date of the procurement contract or energy delivery period.
general.input-form.description.certifica: The level achieved with successful completion of the certification/rating/label scheme.
The underlying score that corresponds to the certification/rating/label level achieved, where applicable.
The floor area this certification/rating/label covers. This is only required if the floor area differs from the GROSS FLOOR AREA included in the ANNUAL DATA section.
The date at which the certification/rating/label was obtained.
general.input-form.description.date_evid: [A GRESB-specific variable only applicable for reporting year 2023. See additional 'GRESB Guidance']. The date on which all evidence for final review was submitted, implying that the performance period covered is prior to and/or up to this date. In cases where approval for certifications/ratings is delayed beyond reporting deadlines due to backlog or other administrative reasons, this field may be used to include the certification/rating in the reporting output.
general.input-form.description.certifica: The date at which the certification/rating/label will/has expire(d).
The primary energy demand (PED) in kWh/area of the asset, which shows how much primary energy is necessary to produce the energy that is delivered to and used by an asset in a year.
Whether the PED meets the nZEB (nearly Zero Energy Building) criteria specified in Directive 2010/31/EU. This nZEB threshold is country and property type specific.
For buildings with a construction permit issued as of 1 January 2021, the percentage lower that the primary energy demand (PED) is than the country-specific threshold set for nZEB.

For buildings with a construction permit issued before 1 January 2021, the percentage of the regional building stock that the asset falls within in terms of its primary energy demand (PED). This must be demonstrated by adequate evidence, which at least compares the performance of the relevant asset to the performance of the national or regional stock (with a construction permit issued before 1 January 2021) and at least distinguishes between residential and non-residential buildings. Enter the percentage as a whole number, e.g. 3% should be entered as 3.
general.input-form.description.renewable: Any internal name to identify the REC.
general.input-form.description.procureme: The method used to acquire renewable energy (e.g., Power Purchase Agreement).
general.input-form.description.market_ba: A way to characterize whether the procurement qualifies for market-based renewable energy claims (e.g., bundled, unbundled).
general.input-form.description.proximity: Geographic distance between the renewable energy source and the buyer’s consumption location.
general.input-form.description.rec_end_d: The termination date of the procurement contract or energy delivery period.
general.input-form.description.purchased: The quantity of renewable energy procured.
general.input-form.description.type_of_i: The type of equipment installed in the asset which contains f-gases as the "working fluid" in heating and cooling systems, but which leak these f-gases, a subset of greenhouse gases which have a high global warming potential, during the life of the equipment.
general.input-form.description.installat: An ID used to identify a specific installation unit/system in the asset using any alpha-numeric-symbol system you choose. This could be physically one unit, like a single air conditioning unit, or it could refer to all the units in a single-split air conditioning system, for example. You may want to use a naming system that includes such information and/or align this ID with an identifier on the installation. The INSTALLATION ID can be re-used ONLY when it is used in a unique combination with INSTALLATION ID and INSTALLATION ID VERSION.

A unique identifier used to keep historical continuity for an installation when other installation details change, like the replacement/decommissioning of a unit in a system, when refrigerants are added or removed/captured from the system during maintenance, or if the related f-gas capacity or leak factor changes. The previous version of the installation could be identified as 1, while the subsequent version identified as 2.

Any textual description of the installation, for your own internal use. For example, you may want to include where the installation(s) is located, information about the installation unit like the number of coils, or other details to supplement the alpha-numeric-symbol naming system in the INSTALLATION ID.
Specify which area the installation relates to. Choose from the predefined dropdown list. This variable impacts which Scope the related emissions are allocated to.
general.input-form.description.f_gas_cap: The weight in kg of the f-gas refrigerant in the installation. Each type of f-gas has its own global warming potential (GWP) and this is used in conjunction with the f-gas capacity and leak factor of the installation to calculate the emissions in CO2 equivalence from this installation.
general.input-form.description.fluorinat: The specific type of f-gas relating to this installation. Each type of f-gas has its own global warming potential (GWP) and this is used in conjunction with the f-gas capacity and leak factor of the installation to calculate the emissions in CO2 equivalence from this installation.
general.input-form.description.cooling_o: The cooling output of the installation (in kW).
general.input-form.description.heating_o: The heating output of the installation (in kW).
general.input-form.description.leak_fact: The percent of the total f-gas capacity the installation leaks/loses over the course of a year due to air conditioning, refrigeration or industrial processes. Each type of f-gas has its own global warming potential (GWP) and this is used in conjunction with the f-gas capacity and leak factor of the installation to calculate the emissions in CO2 equivalence from this installation.
general.input-form.description.installat: The date on which the unit/system was installed. This variable is used to calculate the start date from which fugitive f-gases leak from the installation.
general.input-form.description.decomissi: The date on which the unit/system was decommissioned. This variable is used to calculate the last date from which the installation would leak fugitive f-gases.
general.input-form.description.heat_stre: A chronic, temperature-related risk. Heat stress can create new cooling needs for buildings, which increase operating costs for real estate assets. These extra costs are particularly significant for real estate assets with pre-existing cooling needs, such as data centres, hospitals, homes, and retirement residences. Extreme heat can also disrupt businesses and affect consumer behaviour. It can affect the structural integrity of properties, causing costly damage and shortening the life of buildings and can damage exterior elements, including landscaping and outdoor features.
general.input-form.description.plant_typ: The type of system relating to this installation, for example: VRV/VRF or single-split for air conditioning systems, air-to-water or water-to-water for heat pumps, or stationary chiller for refrigeration systems. This is for your own record keeping.
general.input-form.description.plant_mod: The specific model of the installation.
general.input-form.description.serial_nu: The serial number of the installation unit/system.
general.input-form.description.location_: A description of the physical location of the meter. This may be helpful to individuals tasked with obtaining meter readings, for example.
general.input-form.description.assembly_: F-gas leakage which occurred during assembly (in kg). This is added to the total CO2 equivalent emissions.
general.input-form.description.disposal_: F-gas leakage which occurred during disposal (in kg). This is added to the total CO2 equivalent emissions.
general.input-form.description.avalanche: An acute, solid mass-related risk. A rapid flow of snow down a slope, such as a hill or mountain.
general.input-form.description.landslide: An acute, solid mass-related risk. Land instability characterized by the downward and outward movement of debris, such as rocks, boulders, soil, sediment or logs, affected by soils, surface cover, topography, and climate. Landslides risk is especially relevant in mountain areas and those with unstable soils or steep terrain.
general.input-form.description.subsidenc: An acute, solid mass-related risk. When the ground beneath a property sinks, pulling the property’s foundations down with it. This process can cause the walls and floors to shift, leading to cracks and potentially destabilising the construction of the property. Subsidence can be caused by a range of things including clay shrinkage, trees growing close to the foundations, water washing away soil beneath the property, used or disused mines, formation of underground caverns and poor foundations.
general.input-form.description.climate_r: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.adaption_: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.climate_h: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.expected_: The expected lifespan of the building in years.
general.input-form.description.vulnerabi: The vulnerability assessment performed using climate projections.
The vulnerability assessment performed using the highest resolution.
general.input-form.description.climate_p: The climate projections assessment performed using best practice.
general.input-form.description.economic_: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.adaptatio: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.solutions: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.if_soluti: The indication of alignment with the technical screening criteria under the Climate Adaptation objective of the EU Taxonomy.
general.input-form.description.gross_flo: The total floor area of units meeting affordable housing criteria, as defined by standards adopted by the organization or aligned with local or regional guidelines.
The total floor area of units meeting social housing criteria, as defined by standards adopted by the organization or aligned with local government programs.
The total floor area of units meeting alternative housing criteria, defined to address specific housing needs such as co-living, senior living, or other non-standard housing models.
The total floor area of units designated for free market housing, where rents or prices are determined by market forces without specific affordability or social criteria.

The total floor area of indoor spaces designated as public facilities within the asset, excluding outdoor or exterior areas. Public facilities include spaces designed for community use, such as those leased to generate revenue (e.g., community centers, recreational areas) or transferred to local government for public benefit.
The total area of green spaces, including gardens, planted trees, green roofs, flower beds, and green walls, along with any off-site green spaces supported by the operating partner.
general.input-form.description.desc_of_g: A detailed description of the green spaces, including their purpose, key features, and contribution to environmental sustainability or community well-being.
general.input-form.description.num_of_re: The total number of rental units meeting affordable housing criteria, as defined by regional or national standards.
The total number of rental units meeting social housing criteria, as defined by regional or national programs.
The total number of rental units meeting alternative housing criteria, designed to address unique needs such as senior living or co-housing.
general.input-form.description.number_of: The total number of rental units meeting free market housing criteria.
general.input-form.description.num_of_re: The total number of rental units with a signed green lease, reflecting commitments to sustainable practices between the landlord and tenant.
The total number of housing and public facility units situated near or accessible to community amenities, such as schools, healthcare, parks, and public transport.
general.input-form.description.num_of_te: The total number of tenants with signed lease agreements at the asset.
The total number of tenants with signed lease agreements at the affordable housing units.
The total number of tenants with signed lease agreements at the social housing units.
The total number of tenants with signed lease agreements at the alternative housing units.
The total number of tenants with signed lease agreements at the free market housing units.
general.input-form.description.avg_num_o: The average number of individuals housed per rental unit at the asset.
The average number of beds per rental unit at the asset.
general.input-form.description.vol_of_wa: The total volume of water storage capacity created at the asset.
general.input-form.description.total_num: The total number of community programs initiated or in progress to enhance connectivity, inclusion, and reduce loneliness among residents and local communities. Examples include educational initiatives and inter-generational activities.
general.input-form.description.total_flo: The total floor area of spaces designated as free for community use.
The total floor area of community spaces provided exclusively for residents.
The total floor area of community spaces available to the wider community.
general.input-form.description.num_of_ed: The total number of educational and social programs introduced to assist residents and support the local community.
general.input-form.description.num_of_re: The total number of residents surveyed annually who report feeling less lonely as a result of community programs.
general.input-form.description.percentag: The percentage of the Net Operating Income (NOI) from the real estate asset allocated to sustainable activities during the reporting period. Percentages must be entered as whole numbers (e.g., 3 for 3%, not 0.03).
general.input-form.description.distribut: The ratio of total distributions (including returns of capital, realized capital gains, and dividends) to paid-in capital or equity for the real estate asset. DPI starts at zero when no distributions have been made and increases over time as cash is returned, reaching 1 when the initial capital is fully repaid and trending toward the Total Value to Paid-In (TVPI) or Equity Multiple.
general.input-form.description.underwrit: The originally projected Internal Rate of Return (IRR) for the real estate asset, calculated based on anticipated cashflows from operations, leasing, or sales, excluding vehicle-level fees. This represents the initial expected return on the investment.

The originally projected Equity Multiple for the real estate asset, calculated based on forecasted cashflows from operations, leasing, or disposition. This metric excludes vehicle-level fees and reflects the total anticipated returns relative to the initial capital investment.
general.input-form.description.current_g: The current Internal Rate of Return (IRR) for the real estate asset, calculated using actual cashflows from operations or sales to date and its current book value (if unrealized), excluding vehicle-level fees.

The current Equity Multiple for the real estate asset, reflecting actual cashflows from operations or sales to date and the current book value (if unrealized). This calculation excludes vehicle-level fees and represents the realized or current performance of the asset.
general.input-form.description.projected: The projected Internal Rate of Return (IRR) for the real estate asset, based on actual cashflows to date combined with anticipated cashflows from operations, leasing, or disposition through liquidation. This calculation excludes vehicle-level fees and reflects expected future performance.

The projected Equity Multiple for the real estate asset, calculated using actual cashflows to date and forecasted cashflows through liquidation. This metric excludes vehicle-level fees and estimates the total expected return on investment for the asset's lifecycle.
general.input-form.description.loan_star: The actual date at which the loan starts.
general.input-form.description.current_l: The date of the current loan expiry including executed extension options, if any has been exercised.
general.input-form.description.extension: Additional extension options to current loan expiry, in years
general.input-form.description.describe_: For the additional/non-exercised extension options, describe the criteria or obligations in order to be able to exercise these.
general.input-form.description.loan_hold: The structure of the loan - Whole loan, syndicated and securitized.
general.input-form.description.loan_deno: What currency is the loan denominated in
general.input-form.description.interest_: Which kind of interest rate on loan - fixed, floating or capped floating
The total, current, annual interest rate. This should be the sum of the base rate and the margin.
If the interest rate is floating, what is the current floating base rate. If the interest rate is fixed, what is the fixed rate.
If the interest rate is floating, what is the margin on top of the base rate.
If the interest rate is floating, what base rate is used. LIBOR 1m, 3m, 6m or other.
general.input-form.description.amortisat: Does the loan amortise. Yes or No.
general.input-form.description.yearly_am: If the loan is amortising, at what annual percentage.
general.input-form.description.cross_col: If the asset is cross-collateralised, please indicate which assets are bundled.
general.input-form.description.loan_with: Describe the recourse of the loan.
general.input-form.description.loan_to_c: Ratio of the loan amount used to finance the project to the cost to build the project. Enter the percentage as a number, e.g. 3% should be entered as 3.
general.input-form.description.loan_to_v: Ratio of the loan amount used to finance the project to the value of the project. Can change based on changes in valuation. Enter the percentage as a number, e.g. 3% should be entered as 3.
general.input-form.description.debt_serv: The DSCR should be calculated in the same way as is stated in the loan agreement. If not stated in the loan agreement, the DSCR should be calculated on the basis of the asset's past 12 months' NOI divided by the past year's total debt obligations (amortisation and interest payments). If the asset has been operating less than a year, use the operational period and annualise the data.
general.input-form.description.interest_: The ICR should be calculated in the same way as is stated in the loan agreement. If not stated in the loan agreement, the ICR should be calculated on the basis of the asset's past 12 months' NOI divided by the past year's total interest payments. If the asset has been operating less than a year, use the operational period and annualise the data.
general.input-form.description.ltv_coven: The LTV covenant level in the loan agreement, if any. Enter the percentage as a number, e.g. 3% should be entered as 3.
Describe the consequence if the LTV covenant is breached and not cured.
Describe how the covenant breach can be cured, if possible.
general.gresb.can-be-used-to-populate-gr: Can be used to populate :indicator in the GRESB Portal.

general.input-form.description.meter_id: A unique identifier for a consumption point in the asset using an alpha-numeric system without spaces or symbols. The METER ID can represent a single meter (e.g., single electricity meter in a residential unit) or a group of meters (e.g., for common area electricity). You may want to use a naming system that includes relevant information, such as the type of consumption or area covered, and/or align this ID with the meter identifier used in other internal and external platforms. This identifier is used to map the meters in Scaler with an external provider when automatically pushing or pulling data through an API integration.
general.input-form.description.meter_ver: A sequential number used to maintain historical continuity in a meter when certain meter details change, i.e. SOURCE, COVERED AREA, MONITORING METHOD and PURCHASED BY.
general.input-form.description.meter_des: An open text field to include notable details about the meter, for internal use.
general.input-form.description.area_type: The area + operational control associated with this meter, linked to a floor-area value for the corresponding variable in 'Floor Areas'.
general.input-form.description.monitorin: Where the consumption values for the meter are retrieved from, e.g. an invoice or a smart meter.
general.input-form.description.meter_dat:
The type of data associated with the consumption values for this meter: 
- 'Consumption recording' refers to the actual consumption in a given period;
- 'Meter reading' refers to the total consumption read from the meter on a specific date. Scaler uses the date to automatically calculate consumption since the previously recorded reading; and 
- 'API connection' specifies that all consumption values for this meter are pulled automatically into Scaler from a third-party via an API integration, i.e. consumption values cannot be added manually.
general.input-form.description.meter_ver:
The date from which the meter (version) is no longer active. 
 Please select close/reopen meter to change this value.
general.input-form.description.meter_con: An optional field for your records indicating whether the meter is connected through a large or small connection.
general.input-form.description.supplier-: An optional field to record information about the utility supplier. For market-based emissions accounting linked to a supplier, refer to the variable SUPPLIER.
general.input-form.description.proxy_for: An optional field to indicate whether there is an agreement in place giving the landlord permission to collect/monitor tenant consumption data for this meter.
general.input-form.description.data_conn: An optional field to indicate a third-party data provider where applicable, for example, Metry, Spectral, Lens, Smartvatten.
general.input-form.description.energy_me: Primary/secondary source of the energy consumed, used to define the meter.
general.input-form.description.water_met: Whether the water consumption recorded via this meter is potable or reclaimed water.
general.input-form.description.energy_me: A primary material used to produce a given type of energy, or other descriptor, used to further define the energy SUBCATEGORY for the meter.
general.input-form.description.water_met: Whether the water consumption recorded via this meter is from an indoor or outdoor source.
general.input-form.description.waste_met: The disposal route of the waste.
general.input-form.description.percentag: An indication of the percentage of energy coming from green/renewable sources where the SUBCATEGORY = "District heating and cooling" or "Off-site electricity" + SOURCE = "Mixed green/grey". If the value isn't populated 0 will be used.
general.input-form.description.generated: An indication of whether the green energy from a "District heating & cooling" meter is from an on-site or off-site source, where a value greater than > 0% has been entered in PERCENTAGE GREEN.
general.input-form.description.indoor_ar: Where AREA TYPE = "Mixed indoor/outdoor", the indoor area + operational control associated with this meter, linked to a floor-area value for the corresponding variable in "Floor Areas".
general.input-form.description.percentag: Where AREA TYPE = "Mixed indoor/outdoor", the percentage of consumption that belongs to the indoor area.
general.input-form.description.indoor_co: Where AREA TYPE = "Mixed indoor/outdoor", the area (m2/ft2) that the meter covers, but only when that value is smaller than the value of the associated "Floor Areas" variable. Where it is equal to the associated value, this field is left blank.
general.input-form.description.outdoor_a: Where AREA TYPE = "Mixed indoor/outdoor", the operational control associated with this exterior meter, linked to the value entered for GROSS FLOOR AREA - EXTERIOR in "Floor Areas".
general.input-form.description.outdoor_c: Where AREA TYPE = "Mixed indoor/outdoor", the exterior area (m2/ft2) that the meter covers, but only when that value is smaller than the value entered for GROSS FLOOR AREA - EXTERIOR in "Floor Areas". Where it is equal to the associated value, this field is left blank.
general.input-form.description.consumpti: Where the DATA TYPE selected is "Consumption recording", the date marking the beginning of the time period for the specific instance of consumption.
Where the DATA TYPE selected is "Consumption recording", the date marking the end of the time period for the specific instance of consumption.
The consumption value for the period corresponding to the START and END DATES for this specific instance of consumption.
The unit corresponding to the specific consumption value.

Where the DATA TYPE selected is "Meter reading", the date that this meter reading corresponds to. For meters categorized as "Meter reading", Scaler automatically calculates the consumption value from one meter reading to the next.

Where the DATA TYPE selected is "Meter reading", the value of the meter reading corresponding to this READING DATE. For meters categorized as "Meter reading", Scaler automatically calculates the consumption value from one meter reading to the next.

The cost of this instance of monitored consumption. For example, where the entered consumption comes from an invoice, you may want to include the amount indicated on the invoice and owed to the utility company for this specific instance of consumption.
The quantity of energy, measured in the UNIT OF CONSUMPTION, that is delivered from on-site energy generation sources to the electrical grid.

Where MONITORING METHOD = "Estimation (number of bins)", the number of bins allocated for this waste meter. Along with VOLUME OF WASTE BINS and FILLING LEVEL OF WASTE BINS, this variable is used to calculate waste for each specific instance of consumption inputted.

Where MONITORING METHOD = "Estimation (number of bins)", the full capacity of a waste bin associated with this meter in a UNIT OF CONSUMPTION, e.g. cubic meters (m³) or liters (L). Along with NUMBER OF WASTE BINS and FILLING LEVEL OF WASTE BINS, this variable is used to calculate waste for each specific instance of consumption inputted.

Where MONITORING METHOD = "Estimation (number of bins)", the percent full that the waste bins are for this specific instance of consumption, as an average across all waste bins associated with this meter. Along with NUMBER OF WASTE BINS and VOLUME OF WASTE BINS, this variable is used to calculate waste for each specific instance of consumption inputted.

general.input-form.estimate-using-solar-:
If this option is chosen, you will not be entering consumption yourself but Scaler will estimate consumption data for this type of meter. This is calculated based on the number of solar panels multiplied by the average watt peak provided in 'Reporting data -> Sustainable Characteristics' section. Only when these fields are populated for this asset, we will estimate the consumption.

The data that will be estimated is Production of solar panels. This means you can still input any Redelivery to grid, which will be subtracted from the Production to get to the Consumption of this meter.

general.generate-report.ignore-ownership: Include data from all assets in the reporting year, regardless of ownership date within that year.

An asset may be included in GRESB’s like-for-like calculations without being owned for the full reporting year, provided the following conditions are met:
1. A minimum of 355 days of data is available, including from the period prior to ownership;
2. Data Coverage is positive;
3. Year-over-year Data Coverage remains consistent within a 1% margin;
4. The asset qualifies as a Standing Investment.

If these criteria are satisfied, the asset may be included in the like-for-like analysis using the full-year data.
